channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump's peace plan for Ukraine. And, why Marjorie Taylor Greene is resigning
item.description: European leaders are skeptical of President Trump's peace plan for Ukraine. And, what led Marjorie Taylor Greene to announce she will resign from Congress next year.
item.content:encoded:
European leaders are skeptical of President Trump's peace plan for Ukraine. And, what led Marjorie Taylor Greene to announce she will resign from Congress next year.

(Image credit: Fabrice Coffrini)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: He left Gaza and fled to Europe on a jet ski. Now he hopes to bring his family
item.description: In an extraordinary journey, a Palestinian man used a jet ski to cross the Mediterranean Sea and reach Europe after he fled the war in Gaza.
item.content:encoded:
In an extraordinary journey, a Palestinian man used a jet ski to cross the Mediterranean Sea and reach Europe after he fled the war in Gaza.

(Image credit: Ruth Sherlock)
item.dc:creator: Ruth Sherlock

item.title: A bowhead whale's DNA offers clues to fight cancer
item.description: Scientists searching for new ways to combat cancer think they may have uncovered a promising new lead in the DNA of the bowhead whale.
item.content:encoded:
Scientists searching for new ways to combat cancer think they may have uncovered a promising new lead in the DNA of the bowhead whale.

(Image credit: Danny Lawson/PA Images)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Will technology provide a boost to truck drivers — or will it replace them?
item.description: The American economy depends on truckers. Technology is promising to transform this industry with new driver-assistance features that are meant to make the job safer and less demanding.
item.content:encoded:
The American economy depends on truckers. Technology is promising to transform this industry with new driver-assistance features that are meant to make the job safer and less demanding.

(Image credit: Desiree Rios for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Camila Domonoske

item.title: Virginia's tough rules for felons to regain their voting rights could soon be changing
item.description: Virginia is one of just a few states where only the governor can restore voting rights for people with felony convictions. But Virginia's rules may soon be changing.
item.content:encoded:
Virginia is one of just a few states where only the governor can restore voting rights for people with felony convictions. But Virginia's rules may soon be changing.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Dean Mirshahi

item.title: THC drinks are flying high. A new hemp law could kill the buzz
item.description: Drinks infused with cannabis' buzzy compound THC are wildly popular and available in many states. But a year from now, the hemp-based products could be banned under a newly approved federal law.
item.content:encoded:
Drinks infused with cannabis' buzzy compound THC are wildly popular and available in many states. But a year from now, the hemp-based products could be banned under a newly approved federal law.

(Image credit: Ryan Wiramidjaja)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: 'Nobody wants to come': What if the U.S. can no longer attract immigrant physicians?
item.description: Immigrants make up a significant proportion of all the country's doctors. New policies are making it harder and less appealing for foreign-born physicians to come to the U.S.
item.content:encoded: Immigrants make up a significant proportion of all the country's doctors. New policies are making it harder and less appealing for foreign-born physicians to come to the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: What foods make you happiest? It's not what you think
item.description: As you prepare for your holiday feast, here's something to consider. Research suggests there are certain foods that can help boost our moods and make us happier in the long-run.
item.content:encoded: As you prepare for your holiday feast, here's something to consider. Research suggests there are certain foods that can help boost our moods and make us happier in the long-run.
item.dc:creator: Michaeleen Doucleff

item.title: Give thanks for the discounts: the feast will cost a little less this year
item.description: Shoppers can be thankful for discounts on turkey and stuffing this year. While overall grocery prices are up, this year's Thanksgiving meal should cost a bit less than last year's.
item.content:encoded:
Shoppers can be thankful for discounts on turkey and stuffing this year. While overall grocery prices are up, this year's Thanksgiving meal should cost a bit less than last year's.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: U.S. set to label Maduro-tied Cartel de los Soles as a terror organization
item.description: President Trump's administration is set to ramp up pressure on Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro designating Cartel de los Soles as a terrorist organization. But the entity is not a cartel per se.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump's administration is set to ramp up pressure on Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro designating Cartel de los Soles as a terrorist organization. But the entity is not a cartel per se.

(Image credit: Cristian Hernandez)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
